title: Arsenal have William Saliba concerns after recent visit to training ground
text:

Arsenal reportedly have concerns over a groin injury issue for summer signing William Saliba, although they are confident that the teenager will respond well to training with the club.

The 18-year-old centre-back immediately headed back out on loan to Saint-Etienne following his £27million arrival at the Gunners in the summer, but he picked up a groin problem which delayed the start of his season.

Saliba linked up with his parent club at London Colney to work on his development and fitness during the previous international break, before heading back to France and making his first three appearances of the current season.

The teenager came on as an 89th minute substitute in a 1-0 win at Nimes at the end of last month, before back-to-back starts against Wolfsburg in the Europa League and Lyon in Ligue 1, playing for 90 minutes in both.

(Image: Stuart MacFarlane)

Gunners boss Unai Emery sees Saliba as a key part of his first-team plans for next season, when the France under-20 international has been tipped to make a big impact in the Arsenal defence.

In a Q&A on The Athletic , journalist David Ornstein claims that Arsenal have been impressed with what they've seen from Saliba during his sessions at London Colney both in the gym and out on the training pitch, with his physical prowess singled out.

(Image: REUTERS)

However, there are "specific areas" that the Gunners are concerned about following the injury, with his groin strength mentioned as being key.

The Gunners are also said to be aware that Saliba isn't yet ready for a first-team spot in the Premier League, but it is to be hoped that an injury-free remainder of the campaign and visits to London Colney will help get him up to speed ahead of 2020/21.
description: The defender has recently returned to action on loan at Saint-Etienne following his summer groin injury
